page.title: 18TRANSPORT - ROADS
page.content: {ROADS:}The A3 London to Portsmouth road crosses the area from the deep cutting between Butser Hill and Wardown to the town of Petersfield. Its dual carriageway becomes single carriageway at the base of Butser Hill. This occurs at the end of a fast stretch of road and has been the location of a number of serious accidents. Morning commuters travelling towards Petersfield usually meet a 'tail back' stretching from Maple Durham crossroads to the town. The problem is caused by the high number of vehicles and the miniroundabout and pedestrian crossing in Petersfield. The pedestrian crossing is almost continuously in operation from 0830 to 0900 hours due to schoolchildren and shoppers crossing the A3. Quite minor accidents can produce similar hold ups
